sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均可表示"无知的"之意。
means: ignorant ： 指一般的无知或指不知道某个具体的事。
illiterate ： 指不识字的人或没有文化的人。

sentence.Network_en: Authors are famously ignorant about the realities of publishing.
sentence.Network_cn: 作者们不了解出版界的实际情况，这是人所共知的。

sentence.Network_en: People don'tlike to ask questions for fear of appearing ignorant.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们不喜欢问问题，害怕自己会显得很无知。

sentence.Network_en: Many people are worryingly ignorant of the facts about global warming.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多人竟然不知道地球变暖的事实，实在令人担忧。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin ignorant- 'not knowing', from the verb ignorare (see ignore)

entry.tran: 无知的;愚昧的;(对…)不知情的
entry.def: If you describe someone as ignorant, you mean that they do not know things they should know. If someone is ignorant of a fact, they do not know it.

example.ex: People don't like to ask questions for fear of appearing ignorant...
example.tran: 人们不喜欢问问题,害怕自己会显得很无知。

example.ex: Many people are worryingly ignorant of the facts about global warming.
example.tran: 许多人竟然不知道地球变暖的事实,实在令人担忧。

entry.tran: 无礼的,粗鲁的(一些人认为用该词表达此义欠妥)
entry.def: People are sometimes described as ignorant when they do something that is not polite or kind. Some people think that it is not correct to use ignorant with this meaning.

example.ex: I met some very ignorant people who called me all kinds of names.
example.tran: 我碰到了一些非常粗鲁的家伙,他们用各种脏话骂我。

sentences.sentence: "an unlearned group incapable of understanding complex issues"

means.word_mean: 2. ignorant of the fundamentals of a given art or branch of knowledge;

sentences.sentence: "how can someone that age be so ignorant?"
"inexperienced and new to the real world"

means.word_mean: 4. used of things; lacking sense or awareness;

sentences.sentence: "unversed in the jargon of the social scientist"

auth_sentence.content: Religion can only survive if the flock remains ignorant.
auth_sentence.res_content: Religion can only survive if the flock remains ignorant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Religion can only survive if the flock remains ignorant.

auth_sentence.content: We are all ignorant about one thing or another.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are all ignorant about one thing or another.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are all ignorant about one thing or another.

auth_sentence.content: It's truly the most ignorant thing since racism.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's truly the most ignorant thing since racism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's truly the most ignorant thing since racism.

jushi.english: An ignorant person can be dangerous.
jushi.chinese: 无知的人可能是危险的。

jushi.english: It was an ignorant remark for someone who claims to be an expert.
jushi.chinese: 对于一个自称是专家的人来说,那是浅薄之谈。

jushi.english: He is quite ignorant—he can't even read.
jushi.chinese: 他非常无知——他甚至不识字。
